title: Daniel Notcovich
text:
Hey welcome to my page!
Here’s a little bit about me…
My name is Daniel Notcovich.
I am currently pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Environmental Sciences at the University of California, Santa Barbara. In my area of study, I’ve developed a passion for biocontrol, conservation, and land management. I am particularly interested in sustainable agricultural practices and ecological restoration, and how these can contribute to biodiversity protection and the health of ecosystems.
My coursework and research have focused on evaluating the impact of invasive species and developing biological control methods. Through my work at UCSB’s Biocontrol Lab and the Monteverde Institute in Costa Rica, I’ve been able to contribute to sustainable agricultural practices and ecological restoration efforts.
In addition to my academic pursuits, I have gained hands-on experience in microbial identification technology during my internship at a biotech startup, Biolog. I also have experience in customer service and volunteer work, where I’ve developed leadership skills and a commitment to community service.
In my free time, I enjoy hiking, playing soccer, cooking and eating amazing food, and spending quality time with friends and family. I am excited to continue learning and contributing to the field of environmental sciences, with the goal of promoting sustainable and eco-friendly practices in both agricultural and natural ecosystems.
Browse around and get to know me!

title: Resume
text:
2020- 2024
University of California Santa Barbara
Bachelor of Science in Environmental Sciences
Focus on: Biocontrol, Conservation, and Land Management



UCSB


2016-2020 Northgate High School






October 2022- March 2024
Research Assistant in the Ecology Department at UCSB, under Professor Tom Dudley, on the Santa Clara River Project. Involved in evaluating the impact of Arundo invasion and exploring biological control methods for invasive plants like tamarisk and Cape ivy. Currently developing a research station to support studies on native and non-native species, emphasizing ecological restoration, biodiversity protection, and agricultural sustainability in the Santa Clara River floodplain ecosystem.”



October 2023- December 2023
Extensive research on coffee berry borer behaviors at Cafe Monteverde, Finca LIFE, in Costa Rica, identifying a preference for mature red berries over less mature ones. 101 choice experiments across various maturation stages, informing the development of targeted biocontrol methods. The findings contribute to sustainable agricultural practices, reducing reliance on agrochemicals and supporting the health of small-scale coffee farms. This work supports global efforts towards eco-friendly and socially responsible farming.



June - August 2022
Contributed to a biotech startup specializing in microbial identification technology, phenotypic cell profiling, and metabolic fingerprinting for bacterial and mammalian cells. Conducted lab work, including preparation of chemical identifiers, reagent handling, and quality control assays. Collaborated with the R&D team to identify and report bacterial species for a comprehensive 3,000-bacteria database danielnotcovich2001@gmail.com



July- August 2019
Prepared and ran the performance of biochemical assays in a drug discovery startup company. Prepared plates and chemicals and labeled proteins with fluorescent tags. Quality Control and troubleshooting products developed by the company


Feel free to download my resume or get in touch with me via email.


 
    
  
    
     Resume
